20110111152133.000|20110111152136.000|TR0|
20110111152136.000|20110111152138.000|TR0|You know, the study talks about combat 
20110111152138.000|20110111152141.000|TR0|stress, sexual trauma, brain injuries, 
20110111152141.000|20110111152144.000|TR0|these are realities as we know for so many 
20110111152144.000|20110111152146.000|TR0|women in the military.  Why the gap in 
20110111152146.000|20110111152149.000|TR0|access to benefits?
20110111152149.000|20110111152151.000|TR0|
20110111152151.000|20110111152154.000|TR0|ANURADHA BHAGWATI, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, 
20110111152154.000|20110111152156.000|TR0|SERVICE WOMEN'S ACTION NETWORK:  Well, 
20110111152156.000|20110111152159.000|TR0|there are a couple of really useful 
20110111152159.000|20110111152201.000|TR0|tidbits of information from this study.  I 
20110111152201.000|20110111152204.000|TR0|think the first is that, you know, while 
20110111152204.000|20110111152206.000|TR0|women veterans, certainly the military 
20110111152206.000|20110111152209.000|TR0|community understands that women's roles 
20110111152209.000|20110111152212.000|TR0|in combat have changed dramatically.  
20110111152212.000|20110111152214.000|TR0|Their services upon returning home have 
20110111152214.000|20110111152217.000|TR0|yet to catch up with that fact.
20110111152217.000|20110111152219.000|TR0|
20110111152219.000|20110111152222.000|TR0|So especially in the V.A., which is broken 
20110111152222.000|20110111152224.000|TR0|up into the health administration and the 
20110111152224.000|20110111152227.000|TR0|benefits administration, you're seeing 
20110111152227.000|20110111152229.000|TR0|that especially on the benefits side, 
20110111152229.000|20110111152232.000|TR0|women veterans are not being served as 
20110111152232.000|20110111152235.000|TR0|well as they should  be.  A study 
20110111152235.000|20110111152237.000|TR0|indicated that more women with PTSD from 
20110111152237.000|20110111152240.000|TR0|combat are being denied service-connected 
20110111152240.000|20110111152242.000|TR0|compensation than their male counterparts.
20110111152242.000|20110111152245.000|TR0|
20110111152245.000|20110111152247.000|TR0|And some of that is due to the fact that 
20110111152247.000|20110111152250.000|TR0|we have the combat exclusion policy in 
20110111152250.000|20110111152252.000|TR0|effect which prohibits women from being 
20110111152252.000|20110111152255.000|TR0|assigned to units such as infantry, armor, 
20110111152255.000|20110111152258.000|TR0|special operations units.  But what we're 
20110111152258.000|20110111152300.000|TR0|seeing, of course, in Iraq and Afghanistan 
20110111152300.000|20110111152303.000|TR0|is that women are absolutely being exposed 
20110111152303.000|20110111152305.000|TR0|to hostile fire  everyday, whether or not 
20110111152305.000|20110111152308.000|TR0|they're actually in these units.
20110111152308.000|20110111152310.000|TR0|
20110111152310.000|20110111152313.000|TR0|Women's roles have dramatically, radically 
20110111152313.000|20110111152315.000|TR0|changed on the battlefield.  We have women 
20110111152315.000|20110111152318.000|TR0|everyday as, you know, translators, 
20110111152318.000|20110111152321.000|TR0|members of convoy operations, linguists, 
20110111152321.000|20110111152323.000|TR0|military police and so on, regularly being 
20110111152323.000|20110111152326.000|TR0|exposed to hostile fire  and coming back 
20110111152326.000|20110111152328.000|TR0|with the same wounds of war as men.  We 
20110111152328.000|20110111152331.000|TR0|also see that women are  engaged in roles 
20110111152331.000|20110111152333.000|TR0|such as female engagement teams in the 
20110111152333.000|20110111152336.000|TR0|Marine Corps, lioness teams in the Army, 
20110111152336.000|20110111152338.000|TR0|which is actually in direct violation of 
20110111152338.000|20110111152341.000|TR0|the combat exclusion policy.     And 
20110111152341.000|20110111152344.000|TR0|commanders on the ground know this.  You 
20110111152344.000|20110111152346.000|TR0|know, women are actually patrolling

20110111153759.000|20110111153801.000|TR0|Yes.  You know, I was researching my book 
20110111153801.000|20110111153804.000|TR0|and I found out that George Washington had 
20110111153804.000|20110111153806.000|TR0|started his own personal spiring, which I 
20110111153806.000|20110111153809.000|TR0|found fascinating.  And what he'd done is 
20110111153809.000|20110111153812.000|TR0|enlisted regular, ordinary people.  So, 
20110111153812.000|20110111153814.000|TR0|what I did was, I said, I want to see -- I

20110111153817.000|20110111153819.000|TR0|Department of Homeland Security, I said,

20110111153827.000|20110111153829.000|TR0|doesn't?  And I said, wait, what are you
